hackathon-description-text: Anvil Hack - the student-run hackathon at Goldsmiths, Unviersity of London - is back for the third year! Our hackathon is focussed on the creative applications of technology taking place at a centre of creative computing research. This year, we have been
hackathon-rules:
Use your skills to make something wonderful, arty, musical - anything you build will be awesome. We'll provide you with food, drink, electricity and internet, so that you can get on with the real work - making cool things!
Abide by our code of conduct at all times: https://github.com/hacksmiths/code-of-conduct

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Build Music Hacks with the Spotify Platform

hackathon-description-header: A two-day invention marathon for developers, designers, psychologists, researchers and more. Build projects that answer our challenges and create awesome creative projects.
